name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-N-(1-methylpropyl)-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3479
Reason: 1,3-dioxolane has a melting point of around 40 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for comparison can be 1,3-dioxane, which has a melting point of around 40 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the methyl group (–CH2–) in place of a hydrogen atom reduces the melting point due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The trifluoromethyl group (–F–) increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The fluorine atoms (–F–) increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The dioxane ring (–O–) increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals interactions.
